pgrid.network.router
Class Router

java.lang.Object
  pgrid.network.router.Router
All Implemented Interfaces:
TimerListener
public class Router
extends Object
implements TimerListener

The Router routes messages in the network.

Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Renault John, Roman Schmidt

route

public void route(PGridMessage msg,
                  String strategy,
                  Object routingInfo,
                  RouterListener routerListener)
           throws RoutingStrategyException
Routes a message using a given algorithm.

Parameters:
msg - Message to route
strategy - Strategy to use
routingInfo - a routing data object. This object is routing strategy dependent.
routerListener - A router listener
Throws:
RoutingStrategyException

Throws:
RoutingStrategyException

incomingMessage

public void incomingMessage(PGridMessage message)
Main entry point for all network message. If the peer is responsible for this message, it will be send to the message manager, otherwise it will be routed.

Parameters:
message - new incoming message

informLocalPeer

public void informLocalPeer(PGridMessage msg)
This method should be called by the routing strategy if and only if it has reply false when isResponsible was called and because of some evenement, this has changed.
This method is called, for instance, in the Route method of some routing strategy when the responsible peer depend on whether or not the message was successfuly forwarded.

Parameters:
msg -

sendACK

protected void sendACK(PGridHost host,
                       int code,
                       GUID guid)
Send an acknowledgement message.

Parameters:
host -
code -
guid - the guid of the ACK message

timerTriggered

public void timerTriggered(Object id)
Timer triggered callback method. This method will remove all routing attempts older then a certain amount of time and all old client informations.

Specified by:
timerTriggered in interface TimerListener
Parameters:
id -
